Basically a great puzzle game mixed with a tinge of creepiness and fear. 

The concept of creating portals on flat surfaces in order to make your way to the exit is really cool. There's not just one single way of getting to the end, which leaves you to your creativity and makes it possible for you to actually want to keep retrying the levels even after you've passed it.

Also, you'd be better off not having any emotional attachment towards your Companion Cube. I would know. ;|

And if for some reason you still doubt the obvious truth, yes, the cake is a lie.

Portal was an incredible game. The thing that striked me was despite how generic  most first person shooters are, especially these days, portal takes the time to make it into one of the most original games to this day. Sure, teleportation was heard of before this game, but it added limitations to teleportation that made it a puzzling and fun game. I did play the second portal before playing this one, and if you have too, I can tell you that this is still worth buying. My only complant is how short the game is.
Игровой процесс вращается вокруг Переносного устройства создания порталов — вымышленного устройства, которое позволяет создавать два портала. Порталы ограничены плоскими поверхностями.
schick

Honestly this is one of the best games I ever played, story wise and mechanics wise. This s not the typical puzzle game. There is just something about using portals to tele[port and make robots shoot themselvws that is not only fun but ultimately satisfying. If you have a fe extra bucks and want to buy a game that is not only different but FUN with a good yet short story, this is it. The challenges will sometmes require you to put down the game and come back later. I beat the main story in six hours but it felt a lot longer because I had to play iin 3 two hour sessions. I was a little disappoined that the game didn't go on longer, but then  I remembeed I had bouht Portal 2 as well! I suggest playing this game before the sequel despite the fact that more people are familiar with the 2nd installnent, this one is actually imho more story driven. It is a very linear franchise, a lot like Half-Life actually, but it is  not a failure in that regard. It totally works in this game and to be honest if you don't play the game over again and try to make new decisions when solving puzzles then you are playing it wrong! Yes, i said the game is linear, it is not a wander lust game BUT there are multiple ways to get passed each level and I give many kudos to the devs for that. Actually, Portal 2 was the first ValvE title I had ever played, on xbox 360 when it first came out. It was the game that introduced me to Pc gaming, ValvE and of course, STEAM. I haven't gone back since and with this last winter sale I decided to return the favor to steam by purchasing all of the classic ValvE titles. Honestly, any ValvE game is a winner, This is a company that makes fun, unique, classic challenging yet simple games. IMHO Dota2 is the weakest game on their roster and I still don't totally hate it. There is no reason Portal should not be in your library, most ValvE games run on ANY PC. The only real problem I did have with this game was the mouse sens settings. For some reason the mouse sensitivity and the mouse acceleration were reversed, but when I figured out what was going on I was able to fix it. Even though the first installment of Portal is very short it has bonus maps, community maps and decent replay value as far as story mode goes. Buy it!

Great puzzle FPS. Cool concept, great humor, and fun. Story is a bit short though, can be completed in about 3 hours. But it has bonus maps which you can play.  

Get the Portal Bundle so you can play Portal 2 too.

Что можно сказать об этой игре.... она великолепна. Купив её в 2016 году я понял, что эта игра останется популярной очень очень долго. Она очена занимательна, нужно продумать каждую деталь,каждый шаг. Она не похожа на другие игры своей фантазией. Здесь ты можешь стрель из порталгана, мать его порталгана! А еще турелки скидывать друг на друга. А потом сжечь лучшего друга-компаньона. ПРЕДАТЕЛЬ!.Ну а тортик, чтожь, тортик та ложь друзья мои. Так что 10/10, а я дальше пойду пытаться проносить радио через поле анти-экспроприации

People call this game a classic for a reason. I was one of the kids who missed out on the portal hype until recently when my girlfriend made me give it a go. The love for this game online and the reviews already posted speak to how fun this game is, so let me just echo that sentiment. Great game. 10/10. Would buy agian.

Note, there might not be great replayability with the exception of the advanced maps and the challenges. I haven't cussed so much at a game in a long time. Some of the advanced maps seem impossible until you do a quick search on how to beat them.

In terms of game achievements, I had completed 5/6 advanced maps and then someone Portal locked up. When I restarted it I didn't have any of them completed, and while I had the achievements for completing 2 & 4 of the advanced maps, I was going to have to complete  them all over again to get the achievement for finishing all 6. That got me pretty worked up, but I'm sure I'll try to conquer them again someday.

Portal, along with it's sequel, is in my opinion one of the greatest puzzle games out there, where you must combine your skills of a FPS and a strategy. Not doing that and screw up is guaranteed. 
Think first, do second, or as we say in my country, measure seven times, cut once.
It's also fun and sometimes exiting. Here you are, flying down into your portal to emerge from one above and fly over the pit, with the thought - "will I make it? Did I put the portal high enough? Is the timing perfect?" and so on.
But alas! you're all alone, with only G.L.A.D.O.S. to cheer you with some lousy jokes. But most importantly...
THE CAKE IS A LIE!!!

P.S. For those of you "explorer" gamers - this game has a very fascinating back-story, possibly tangled up with the back-story of Half Life.

My mark for this game - 9/10

[h1][b]Q[/b]uick [b]R[/b]eview: [b]PORTAL[/b][/h1]
I borrowed the PS3 version of this game from a friend, but eventually bought the Portal Bundle on Steam during the Winter Sales... And never have I gotten so much value for only €5! It's taken me nine full years before finally playing this gem and I sincerely regret not playing this sooner.

[h1][b]P[/b]ros[/h1]
The puzzles are [b][i]innovating[/i][/b] and I find that solving them can be really rewarding (it honestly makes you feel more intelligent). Furthermore, Portal's script is [b][i]absolutely hilarious[/i][/b] and plays a huge part in setting the tone; [b][i]GLaDOS[/i][/b] is without a doubt one of the greatest video game characters of all time.

[h1][b]C[/b]ons[/h1]There really are only two downsides to Portal: its relatively [b][i]short length[/i][/b] and the [b][i]lack of multiplayer[/i][/b]; however, these issues are adressed in Portal 2. Oh, and sadly, [spoiler]the cake really is a lie :([/spoiler]

[h1][b]F[/b]inal [b]V[/b]erdict[/h1]
Get the Portal Bundle right now. Trust me, you will not regret it.
One of the greatest and most mind-bending games ever. This will make you think outside the box for sure!
